CodeBehindForm
Attribute VB_GlobalNameSpace = False
Attribute VB_Creatable = True
Attribute VB_PredeclaredId = True
Attribute VB_Exposed = False
'    SciFairMaster.mdb  (All class objects and modules)
'
'    Copyright (C) 2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,
'                  2014  Dennis e.Spanogle
'
'    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
'    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
'    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
'    (at your option) any later version.
'
'    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
'    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
'    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
'    GNU General Public License for more details.
'
'    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
'    along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
 '  Rev 540  cleaned up to not have hardcoded extensions or linked database name.
  '
Option Compare Database
Option Explicit
Private RepeatInterval As Double
Private ActionLogRS As Recordset
Private criteria As String
Private ExhibitStudRS As Recordset
Private LastExn As Long ' The actual Exhibit number of last exhibit
Private PrevSavedEXN As Long
Private Firstaddexhibit As Long
Private NextAddExhibit As Long
Private FirstNewExn As Long
Private wrkexn As Long
Private ptext As String
Private TotalReNumEx As Integer
Private TotalNewEx As Integer
Private NewExSinceBU As Integer
Private FirstExn As Long
Private DataDir As String
Private LinkedDataDir As String
Private DataFile As String
Private DoingSQLcopy As Boolean   ' rev 5.4.4 544
Private BackedUpTo As String   '  rev 5.4.4. 544
Private BackupNum As Long      ' made global rev 5.4.5 545
Private locend As Integer    '  rev 5.4.6  used when determining location of SciFairWebData
                              ' and to identify cause of error if any.
                              




Private Sub btnBrowse_Click()
 Dim strFileName As String
 Dim StrFilePath As String
 Dim StrFilePathName As String
 Dim Strfilter As String
On Error GoTo SubError
' rev 540 removed hardcoded file name
MsgBox "The next Dialog will ONLY find files with the name " & DataFile & vbCrLf & _
       "Locate the copy of " & DataFile & " you wish to backup. "
Strfilter = ahtAddFilterItem(Strfilter, DataFile & " Files (" & DataFile & ")", DataFile)
StrFilePathName = ahtCommonFileOpenSave( _
                Filter:=Strfilter, OpenFile:=True, _
                DialogTitle:="Select " & DataFile & " File", _
                Flags:=ahtOFN_HIDEREADONLY)
If IsNull(StrFilePathName) Then GoTo ErrorHandler1
If StrFilePathName = "" Then GoTo ErrorHandler1
Dim ii As Integer
 For ii = Len(StrFilePathName) To 1 Step -1
        If Mid(StrFilePathName, ii, 1) = "\" Then
            StrFilePathName = Left(StrFilePathName, ii)
            
            Exit For
        End If
 Next
 Me.txtOther.SetFocus
 Me.txtOther.Text = StrFilePathName
 Dim tDatadir As String
 LocOption = 2
      Me.txtOther.SetFocus
      tDatadir = Me.txtOther.Text
      LblDestination.Caption = "Backup Location: " & tDatadir & "Backup\"
      Me.btnStartBackup.SetFocus
 
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox "browse error " & Err.Description
  Exit Sub
ErrorHandler1:
  MsgBox "Canceled"
  Exit Sub
End Sub

Private Sub BtnHelp_Click() 'rev 5.4.5  545  added can have physical drive S:
  MsgBox "The default path for the destination assumes:" & vbCrLf & _
         " There is a physical drive S: on this PC with a folder [Backup] OR.. " & vbCrLf & _
         "  1. The destination drive or folder containing 'Backup' has been shared." & vbCrLf & _
         "  2. The shared folder has been mapped to drive 'S'" & vbCrLf & _
         "   Example: (shared folder or drive )" & vbCrLf & _
         "   [Folder a] <-- Share this, higher level or next folder" & vbCrLf & _
         "     [Folder b]  <-- Map this folder as 'S' " & vbCrLf & _
         "        [Backup] <-- where the backup will go" & vbCrLf & _
         "   "

         
End Sub

Private Sub btnLocSave_Click()
'  rev 540   find a folder for destination copy
On Error GoTo SubError
Dim outstr As String
outstr = BrowseFolder("Select Folder to save backup")
outstr = outstr & "\"
txtOutUserSel.SetFocus
txtOutUserSel.Text = outstr
OutOption = 2   ' rev 540  assume user wants to go to this location.
Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox "Canceled"

End Sub

Private Sub btnStartBackup_Click()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If Me.ckbSetAuto = -1 Then
      Dim hours As String
      Dim minutes As String
      Dim repeat As String
      Dim Loccolon As Integer
      repeat = Me.tbRepeatTime
      Loccolon = InStr(1, repeat, ":")
      If Loccolon = 0 Then
        MsgBox "Please enter repeat time as hr:min (Colon required)" & vbCrLf & _
               " Examples    0:30,  1:0,  2:30"
        Exit Sub
      End If
      hours = Mid(repeat, 1, Loccolon - 1)
      minutes = Mid(repeat, Loccolon + 1, Len(repeat) - Loccolon)
      RepeatInterval = 1000 * (60 * ((60 * hours) + minutes))
      Me.tbStatus.Caption = "Next Backup Reminder @ " & _
               Format(Now + (RepeatInterval / 86400000#), "hh:mm AMPM")
      Me.TimerInterval = RepeatInterval
   End If
   'DataDir = "C:\SF_Access\Data" ' This is when backup is run from SciFairMaster
                                 ' on same PC as the master file ScifairData
   'DataDir = "S:"        ' This when backup is run on a PC that has all
                        'tables Linked to SciFairData on a server or master PC"
                        'and when that the directory '...SF_Access\Data' on the
                        'server is mapped as drive 'S:'
   ' rev 540  removed already set 'DataFile = "SciFairData.mdb"
   '  ----------------------------------------------------------------------
   'If LocOption.Value = 2 Then  '  this is default Backup disabled
   '  MsgBox "You must select the location of " & DataFile & vbCrLf & _
   '         "    " & vbCrLf & _
   '         "If you select 'Other' then type the full directory" & vbCrLf & _
   '         "in the space provided. i.e.  D:\MyDataBase\Thedata\ "
   '  Exit Sub
   'End If
   'DataDir = "C:\SF_Access\Data\"  'if locoption.value = 1
  ' If LocOption.Value = 5 Then
  '    DataDir = "C:\Databases\SF_Access\Data\"
  ' End If
  ' If LocOption.Value = 2 Then
  '    DataDir = "S:\"
  ' End If
   If LocOption.Value = 1 Then
      DataDir = LinkedDataDir
   End If
   If LocOption.Value = 2 Then
      Me.txtOther.SetFocus
      DataDir = Me.txtOther.Text
      Me.btnStartBackup.SetFocus
   End If
   Me.txtWMsg.ForeColor = vbRed
   Me.txtWMsg.Caption = "Wait - Working"
   Me.txtWMsg.Visible = True
   DoEvents
   
   BackedUpTo = " None"   ' rev 544 5.4.4
   Call DoBackup  ' All OK so do first back up
   Me.txtWMsg.ForeColor = vbBlue
   Me.txtWMsg.Caption = BackedUpTo  ' rev 544 5.4.4
   
   'Me.txtWMsg.Visible = False
   DoEvents
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   If Err.Number = 76 Then
   ' rev 546 5.4.6 try to see if error is in backup location or the location of SciFairWebData.
     If locend = 99 Then
       MsgBox "Website backup problem.  Check that SciFairWebData and SQL backups" & vbCrLf & _
              "are located as indicated in the FairInfo table WebDbPath field"
          Me.txtWMsg.Caption = "Web Backup Failed"
     Else
       MsgBox "Directory error. Check that the backup location is correct and/or " & vbCrLf & _
              "that the S drive has been shared and mapped correctly."   ' rev 545 5.4.5
       Me.txtWMsg.Caption = "Backup Failed"
     End If
   Else
     If Err.Number = 70 Then
        MsgBox "SciFairData.mdb is 'Locked' and cannot be copied at this time!" & vbCrLf & _
        " Perhaps another user is connected to SciFairData or you have other open forms." & vbCrLf & _
        " Close all other copies of SciFairMaster and other forms in your SciFairMaster and try again." & vbCrLf & _
        "Note: Sometimes SciFairData is left 'locked' (for various reasons) and you will need to " & vbCrLf & _
        " wait for timeouts to reset the lock (overnight). In this case, try the backup later."
         Me.txtWMsg.Caption = "Backup " & BackupNum & vbCrLf & "Failed!"
    
     Else
        If DoingSQLcopy = True Then  ' rev 544 5.4.4
           MsgBox "SQL Backup set for current month does not exist!" & vbCrLf & _
                  "You may want to do an SQL database backup using the web site."   ' rev 545 5.4.5
          Me.txtWMsg.Caption = BackedUpTo
       
        Else
           MsgBox Err.Description
        End If
     End If
   End If
End Sub
Private Sub DoBackup()
 On Error GoTo SubError
 Dim FileDirectory As String
 'Dim BackupNum As Long   made global rev 545 5.4.5
 Dim SciFairData As String
 Dim backupfile As String
 Dim BackupDir As String
 Dim i As Long
 Dim msg As String
 DoingSQLcopy = False   '  for error message if no SQL backup file exists. rev 5.4.4   544
' msg = "  - - - - - -      BACKUP      - - - - - -   " & vbCrLf & _
'       " All Users must STOP WORK to continue!       " & vbCrLf & _
'       " ALL Forms, Reports, Queries, and/or Tables  " & vbCrLf & _
'       "  must be CLOSED (including those on this PC)" & vbCrLf & _
'       "  " & vbCrLf & _
'       " " & vbCrLf & _
'       " ONLY AFTER ALL USERS STOP WORK, CLICK [OK]"
'If Me.ckbSetAuto = -1 Then
'  msg = msg & " " & vbCrLf & _
'       "To assure continued repeated updates, do not " & vbCrLf & _
'       "exit this form or SciFairMaster. "
'End If
' ************ find last backup number from the Table 'ActionLog' *********
 criteria = "SELECT * FROM ACTIONLOG WHERE ACT_TABLE like 'Backup: LstExn*' " & _
             " ORDER BY KEY DESC;"
 Set ActionLogRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
 With ActionLogRS
   If .EOF Then
     BackupNum = 1
     PrevSavedEXN = 0  ' this will cause list to list all new entered Exhibits
   Else
     .MoveFirst
     BackupNum = !Key + 1
     PrevSavedEXN = Mid(!ACT_Table, 16, 6)
   End If
   .Close
 End With
 ' ******  Copy SciFairData from it's directory to the backupdirectory ****
 ' Find it
 ' ------------------     Directory and file names ------------------------
 ' Would be really nice to find the directory of the linked tables.
 '  then Data dir does not have to be set.
 
'==============Rev 5.3.3   application.search has been removed in access 2007
' new code  find SciFairData.mdb in the user selected directory
Dim FolderLength As Integer
Dim FNAME As String
Dim objFSO As FileSystemObject
Dim objFolder As folder
Dim objFile As File

Dim FileCount As Integer
Dim SourceDir As String    ' rev 540
Dim webFileDirectory As String ' rev 5.4.6  546
FileCount = 0
'''rev 540
'  SciFairData = DataDir & DataFile  ' The source location and file
If Me.LocOption = 2 Then
  Me.txtOther.SetFocus
  SciFairData = Me.txtOther.Text & DataFile
  SourceDir = txtOther.Text
Else
  SciFairData = LinkedDataDir & DataFile
  SourceDir = LinkedDataDir
End If
If SourceDir = "" Then
   MsgBox "Please Enter the Other Source (Path)"
   Exit Sub
End If
Set objFSO = New FileSystemObject
Set objFolder = objFSO.GetFolder(SourceDir)
For Each objFile In objFolder.Files
  FolderLength = Len(SourceDir) + 1
  FNAME = Mid(objFile, FolderLength)
  If FNAME = DataFile Then
      FileCount = FileCount + 1
   End If
Next objFile
If FileCount <> 1 Then
    GoTo nofile
End If


  ' Create Backupfile directory
'  rev 540   could have user seleted backup location
If OutOption.Value = 1 Then
  'BackupFile = SourceDir & "Backup\"
  backupfile = LblDestination.Caption  'Rev 5.4.4  544  This can be changed by changing in the form with design view.
Else
  Me.txtOutUserSel.SetFocus
  backupfile = Me.txtOutUserSel.Text
  Me.btnStartBackup.SetFocus
  If backupfile = "" Then
    MsgBox " Please select a folder for the backup destination location. "
    Exit Sub
  End If
End If
  ' make sure directory is there
   '  ---- add in future  ----
  ' complete path for save

BackupDir = backupfile   '  rev 540  used for display onform in log?
backupfile = backupfile & Format(BackupNum, "0000") & _
              Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & DataFile
' ********  old code pre rev 5.3.3
' With Application.FileSearch
'  .NewSearch
'  .LookIn = DataDir
'  .SearchSubFolders = False
'  .FileName = DataFile
'  .MatchTextExactly = True
'   SciFairData = .LookIn & "\" & .FileName
'  .FileType = msoFileTypeDatabases
'  If .Execute() > 0 Then
'      For i = 1 To .FoundFiles.count
'        If Dir(.FoundFiles(i)) = DataFile Then
'           SciFairData = .FoundFiles(i)
'           Exit For
'        End If
'     Next i
'     If i > .FoundFiles.count Then
'          GoTo nofile
'     End If
'  Else
'    GoTo nofile
'  End If
'  ' remove filename to get directory for SciFairData.mdb
'  i = InStr(SciFairData, DataFile)
'  If i = 0 Then GoTo nofile ' should never happen
'  ' Create Backupfile directory
'  BackupFile = Mid(SciFairData, 1, i - 1) & "Backup\"
'  ' make sure directory is there
'   '  ---- add in future  ----
'  ' complete path for save
'  BackupFile = BackupFile & Format(BackupNum, "0000") & _
'              Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & DataFile
' End With



' get a snapshop before we back up
 Dim rs As Recordset
Again:
 criteria = "SELECT * FROM FairInfo WHERE FAIR_YEAR = " & FairYear()
 Set rs = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenSnapshot)
 If rs.EOF Then
      MsgBox "Table FairInfo has no record for fair year " & FairYear() & vbCrLf & _
               "Do the backup a different way!"
       rs.Close
       Exit Sub
    
 End If
 Firstaddexhibit = rs!FIRST_ADD_EXHIBIT
 NextAddExhibit = rs!NEXT_ADD_EXHIBIT
 webFileDirectory = rs!WebdbPath   ' rev 5.4.6  546   SciFairWebData was same place as SciFairData
 rs.Close
 criteria = "SELECT ExhibitStudents.EXN, ExhibitStudents.F_ORD, " & _
 "[LNAME] & ', ' & [FNAME] & ' ' & [MI] AS Name, ExhibitData.NCAT " & _
 "FROM Persons RIGHT JOIN (Students RIGHT JOIN (ExhibitData RIGHT JOIN " & _
 "ExhibitStudents ON ExhibitData.EXN = ExhibitStudents.EXN) ON " & _
 "Students.STID = ExhibitStudents.STID) ON (Persons.PID = Students.PID) " & _
 "AND (Persons.PID = Students.PID) AND (Persons.PID = Students.PID) " & _
 "WHERE F_ORD = 1 ORDER By [LNAME] & ', ' & [FNAME] & ' ' & [MI];"
 ' Copy the file from SciFairDat to BackupFile
' ****************   NOW .. DO Backup **********************
 ' next This will cause an error, I will close recordset and come back
 Set ExhibitStudRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
 On Error GoTo IsMyLinked  ' <-- **********  NOTICE THIS
 FileCopy SciFairData, backupfile 'This will cause an error - I WANT THE ERROR
 ' the error will prove I am backing up the current linked database
 ' If ther is an error I come back to TryCopyAgain:
 ' If NO ERROR - well I just backed up the wrong file
'     seems I am just doing a copy on a file not linked into SciFairMaster
 MsgBox "Reminder: You have backed up a file different than the 'Linked' SciFairData!" & vbCrLf & _
        "The SciFairData file you selected is NOT Linked" & vbCrLf & _
        "to this copy of SciFairMaster (i.e. with Tools 'Linked Table Manager')" & vbCrLf & _
        SciFairData & "(not linked) WAS copied to " & vbCrLf & _
        backupfile  '  & vbCrLf"  & _
     '   " The table 'ActionLog' in the 'Linked' SciFairData file " & vbCrLf & _
     '   " Now has some in-appropriate entries! " & vbCrLf & _
     '   " Select the 'Linked' database to back up the active data - or get help!"
 ExhibitStudRS.Close
 Exit Sub
IsMyLinked:
 If Err.Number = 70 Then  ' good, I tried to copy the file with a recordset open
   GoTo TryCopyAgain ' go back close record set and try again
 Else
    If Err.Number = 76 And OutOption = 1 Then  ' no backupdirectory? or other
       MsgBox "Can not find " & BackupDir & vbCrLf & _
           "You must create subFOLDER 'Backup' in the Source Directory " & vbCrLf & _
           "This is where the backups will be stored! "
    Else
      MsgBox "File Copy error: " & Err.Description & " Check directories, file locations, Write Enabled, Etc." & vbCrLf & _
           "Get help if you are having problems"
    End If
    Exit Sub
 End If
TryCopyAgain:
 On Error GoTo SubError  ' <-- *******  NOTICE Set it backhowever not goes to the calling sub errors trap??
 ExhibitStudRS.Close
 FileCopy SciFairData, backupfile
 BackedUpTo = "Backed Up (" & BackupNum & "):" & vbCrLf & " SciFairData"
 '  Back up done ------ -------------
 ' open the  exhibits data. Would Prefer to open exhibitstudrs first
 ' then copy file but I get permission denied if open OR. if any other
 ' forms on this pc or the pc's sharing SciFairData.mdb if any form
 ' report, query, or table is open.
 Set ExhibitStudRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
 ' Count New Exhibits, Find Last 'New' (>100000) Exhibit number entered
 
 ' if no Action log of backup, assume need ALL listed, starting with 100000
 
 LastExn = 0
 FirstExn = 999999
 FirstNewExn = 999999
 TotalReNumEx = 0       ' nums less than 200000
 TotalNewEx = 0         ' nums > 200000
 NewExSinceBU = 0       ' nums > PrevSavedExn (last number saved)
 With ExhibitStudRS
   Do While Not .EOF
     If !EXN > LastExn Then LastExn = !EXN ' setting largest exhibit number
     If !EXN > Firstaddexhibit - 1 Then    ' FirstAddExhibit = 100001 (constants)
       TotalNewEx = TotalNewEx + 1        ' count total new exhibits
       If !EXN < FirstNewExn Then
          FirstNewExn = !EXN                 ' setting first exhibit number > 100000
       End If
     End If
     ' for next if PrevSavedEXN = 0 (no backup log) then will count ALL
     ' exhibits > 100000 (assume all these are new since no last backup)
     If !EXN > PrevSavedEXN And !EXN > Firstaddexhibit - 1 Then
        NewExSinceBU = NewExSinceBU + 1     ' > lastsaved exhibit number
     End If
     If !EXN < Firstaddexhibit Then
        TotalReNumEx = TotalReNumEx + 1
     End If
     .MoveNext
   Loop
   .Close
 End With
 ' at this point PrevSavedEXN is from the last backup log record else = 0
 '   if NO backup record in log then make assumption = 100000
 '  if last time saved were no new (ie < 100000) then also assume = 10000
 If PrevSavedEXN = 0 Or PrevSavedEXN < Firstaddexhibit Then
    PrevSavedEXN = Firstaddexhibit - 1
 End If
 '
 ' Have good value for lastexn so  ----Add a record to the action log -------
 ' rev 540 added backup dir location
 Call ScifairLog("Backup: LstExn " & Format(LastExn, "000000"), BackupNum, _
   Format(BackupNum, "0000") & Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & DataFile & " AT " & BackupDir)
 ' rev 540 added path
 Me.tbLast.Caption = Format(BackupNum, "0000") & _
   Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & DataFile & " AT " & BackupDir
 Me.tbNewEx.Visible = True
 Me.tbNewExNote.Visible = True
 '  ----Backup and LOG DONE so find out what to print -----------
 ' See if there has been a sort and renumber (resets NEXT_ADD_EXN)
 ' If LastExn < PrevSavedEXN Then  for sure been renumber
 ' but... what if renumbered , then addded more before update that total added
 ' prior to last update?  How test this? - OK  Look in Action Log for a sort and
 ' renumber.. that will be second test
 If Me.ckbSetAuto = -1 Then
   Me.tbStatus.Caption = "Next Backup Reminder @ " & _
     Format(Now + RepeatInterval / 86400000, "hh:mm AMPM")
   Me.tbReminder.Visible = True
 End If
 Me.tbNewEx.Caption = "0"   ' assume no new exhibits were backed up
 ' Then find out how many new entries were backed up this time
 ' All this info is save in the Table 'ActionLog'
 If LastExn < Firstaddexhibit - 1 Then '    NO LISTS IF NO NEW EXHIBITS
   GoTo DoOther
 End If
 Me.tbNewEx.Caption = NewExSinceBU
 '    come here only if had new exhibits   check if need to print any --------
 ' first see if did sort renumber
 If LastExn < PrevSavedEXN Then ' no need to check any further - did sort/renumber
    PrevSavedEXN = FirstNewExn
 Else ' go see if log activity indicates a renumber
  criteria = "SELECT * FROM ACTIONLOG WHERE ACT_TABLE like 'Backup: LstExn*' " & _
             "OR ACT_TABLE = 'Sort and Renum New:*'" & _
             " ORDER BY Date DESC;"   ' list latest first
  Set ActionLogRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
  With ActionLogRS
   If .EOF Then
      ' already have PreSavedEXN set to 100000 (FIRST_ADD_EXHIBIT - 1)
   Else
     ' Search for logs of backups and sort/renumbers -------
     Dim lastbackup As Long
     Dim lastrenum As Long
     ' find the first back up and first sortrenum
     .FindFirst "ACT_TABLE like 'Backup: LstExn*'"
     If Not .NoMatch Then
        lastbackup = .AbsolutePosition
     Else
        lastbackup = 0
     End If
     .MoveFirst
     .FindFirst "ACT_TABLE like 'Sort and Renum New:*'"
     If Not .NoMatch Then
        lastrenum = .AbsolutePosition
     Else
        lastrenum = 0
     End If
     If lastrenum > 0 Then ' This means we have done a renumber
       If lastbackup > 0 Then '  have a backup and a renumber in log
         If lastrenum < lastbackup Then '  Have renumbered since last backup
           ' sorted descending so most recent has smallest record number.
           PrevSavedEXN = FirstNewExn
         Else   ' backup since last renumber this has all aready happened
           ' do nothing
         End If
       Else  ' NO BACKUP  = had a renumber but NO BACKUP 'probably redundant
          PrevSavedEXN = FirstNewExn
        End If
     Else ' No logged renumber so must rely on the next check as only way
       ' Hum?  had a log, lastEXN >= PrevSavedEXN, no renum since last backup
       ' THEN... must be OK as is
     End If
   End If
   .Close
  End With
 End If  ' if lastEXN < PrevSavedEXN
' -------------  Make a printout if requested ---------------------------
 If LastExn - PrevSavedEXN > 0 Then  ' i.e. have some to print
    DoCmd.OpenReport "xBackup Exhibits List", acViewPreview, , _
            "EXN > " & PrevSavedEXN
 End If
 '  rev 5.4.4   544
DoOther:    ' come here from above if no reports due to no exhibits etc.
'Rev 546 5.4.6  Changed  backup of SciFairWebData and SQL backupset so it can be
'   from a different location than SciFiarData.
Dim WebSourceDir As String

' find the last '\' in the string and get everything up to and including the '\'
'  note  locend is global
locend = InStrRev(webFileDirectory, "\Sci")   ' THis will always be .....\SciFairWebData.mdb
If locend = 0 Then
  ' handle error
End If
WebSourceDir = Mid(webFileDirectory, 1, locend)
locend = 99   ' use this to identify the error that may occure if location of SciFairWebData is wrong.
              ' because at this point we know the backupDir is OK since already did backup of SciFairData
 If CheckWebBk.Value = True Then
 ' rev 546 5.4.6 change SourceDir to WebSourceDir
    FileCopy WebSourceDir & "SciFairWebData.mdb", BackupDir & Format(BackupNum, "0000") & _
              Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & "SciFairWebData.mdb"
    BackedUpTo = BackedUpTo & vbCrLf & " SciFairWebData"
 End If
 If CheckSQLBk.Value = True Then
     DoingSQLcopy = True
     Dim Mont As String
     Dim Yrr As String
     Dim SqlBUSetname As String
     Mont = Format(Now, "mm")
     Yrr = Format(Now, "yyyy")
     '   sample  StemASPNETDB_BUSET_Started_2011-10.bak
     SqlBUSetname = "StemASPNETDB_BUSET_Started_" & Yrr & "-" & Mont & ".bak"
     ' rev 546 5.4.6 change SourceDir to WebSourceDir
     FileCopy WebSourceDir & "Backup\" & SqlBUSetname, BackupDir & Format(BackupNum, "0000") & _
              Format(Now, "(mmddyy_hh_mm AMPM)") & SqlBUSetname
     BackedUpTo = BackedUpTo & vbCrLf & " SQL Backup set"
 End If
 If BackupNum > 50 Then
   MsgBox "FYI,You have created more than 50 backups that are logged in Action Log." & vbCrLf & _
          "At your convenience you can reset the backup number to 001 as follows:" & vbCrLf & _
          " - Open Table ActionLog and Sort the column 'Act_Table'." & vbCrLf & _
          " - Locate all records where Act_Table starts with 'Backup: '" & vbCrLf & _
          " - Note where the last few backups are located (FYI only)" & vbCrLf & _
          " - Delete all the records where Act_Table starts with 'Backup: '" & vbCrLf & _
          "   (To free up disc space you may also want to delete older backup files.)"
 
 End If
 Exit Sub
nofile:
    MsgBox "File " & SourceDir & DataFile & " Not found!" & vbCrLf & _
           "Select another location or if you are having problems " & vbCrLf & _
           "call your Network administrator or the programmer"
    Exit Sub
SubError:
 If Err.Number = 76 And OutOption = 1 Then
    MsgBox "Can not find " & BackupDir & "Backup " & vbCrLf & _
           "You must create subFOLDER 'Backup' in the Source Directory! " & vbCrLf & _
           "This is where the backups will be stored! "
 Else
  If Err.Number = 70 Then   ' Never get here with code as of 5.4.5
    MsgBox "Close ALL OPEN 'Tables', 'Queries', 'Forms', Reports " & vbCrLf & _
           "on this PC and on PCs running SciFairSlave - then try again"
   Else
     If DoingSQLcopy = True Then
           MsgBox "SQL Backup set for current month does not exist!" & vbCrLf & _
                  "You may want to do an SQL database backup using the website Administration area."
     Else
          MsgBox "DoBackup " & Err.Description
     End If
   End If
 End If
End Sub
Private Sub btnStopBackup_Click()
  DoCmd.Close
End Sub



Private Sub Form_Open(Cancel As Integer)
 On Error GoTo SubError
 criteria = "SELECT * FROM ACTIONLOG WHERE ACT_TABLE Like 'Backup: LstExn*' " & _
             " ORDER BY KEY DESC;"
 Set ActionLogRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
 With ActionLogRS
   If .EOF Then
     Me.tbLast.Caption = "No backups found in Action Log"
   Else
     .MoveFirst
     Me.tbLast.Caption = !Name
   End If
   .Close
 End With
 '  rev 5.3.3     find the location of the data base that is linked  (Categories in linked).
 Dim strFullPath As String
 strFullPath = Mid(DBEngine.Workspaces(0).Databases(0).TableDefs("Categories").Connect, 11)
 ' rev 540 another better way
 Dim db As DAO.Database
 Set db = CurrentDb
 Dim loc As Recordset
 Set loc = db.OpenRecordset("SELECT * FROM MSysObjects WHERE Name = 'FairInfo'")
 If Not loc.EOF Then
    strFullPath = loc!Database  ' this is the directory and database name for the linked table
 End If
 ' end rev 540
 Dim i As Integer
 LinkedDataDir = "Not found"
 LinkedDataDir = strFullPath
 For i = Len(strFullPath) To 1 Step -1
        If Mid(strFullPath, i, 1) = "\" Then
            LinkedDataDir = Left(strFullPath, i)
            DataFile = Right(strFullPath, Len(strFullPath) - i)  'rev 540
            LocOption.Value = 1   ' set the radio button to backup linked database
            Exit For
        End If
 Next
 'Rev 540  show path and filename
 lblLinked.Caption = "'Linked': " & strFullPath
 'rev 5.4.4   544  mod the form for default - not the linked data dir
 'LblDestination.Caption = "Backup will be made in " & LinkedDataDir & "Backup\"
 Me.txtWMsg.Visible = False
 Me.tbNewEx.Visible = False
 Me.tbNewExNote.Visible = False
 Me.ckbSetAuto.Value = 0
 Me.tbRepeatTime = "1:0"
 Me.tbStatus.Caption = ""
 'rev 540 not next line
' Me.LabelSelBox.Caption = "Location of database (SciFairData.mdb)"
 Me.tbReminder.Visible = False
 Exit Sub
SubError:
 MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Timer()
  On Error GoTo ErrorSub
  'Call DoBackup
  DoCmd.OpenForm "xBackup Reminder"
  Me.tbStatus.Caption = "TIME TO BACKUP!"
  Exit Sub
ErrorSub:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Unload(Cancel As Integer)
   If Me.TimerInterval > 0 Then
      If MsgBox("AutoBackup is Running! Do you want to exit?", _
                vbYesNo, "Backup (Form)") = vbNo Then
      
         Cancel = True  ' does not unload cancel the operation
         Exit Sub
      End If
   End If
End Sub




Private Sub LocOption_AfterUpdate()
    Dim tDatadir As String   ' rev 540
   If LocOption.Value = 1 Then
      tDatadir = LinkedDataDir
      LblDestination.Caption = "Backup Location: " & tDatadir & "Backup\"
   End If
   If LocOption.Value = 2 Then
      Me.txtOther.SetFocus
      tDatadir = Me.txtOther.Text
      LblDestination.Caption = "Backup Location: " & tDatadir & "Backup\"
      Me.btnStartBackup.SetFocus
   End If
End Sub




Private Sub txtOther_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   Dim tDatadir As String
   If LocOption.Value = 1 Then
      tDatadir = LinkedDataDir   ' rev 540  not necessary
   End If
   If LocOption.Value = 2 Then
      'Me.txtOther.SetFocus
      tDatadir = Me.txtOther.Text
      LblDestination.Caption = "Backup Location: " & tDatadir & "Backup\"
      'Me.btnStartBackup.SetFocus
   End If
End Sub
